abstract: Highlights from this weekend's Values Voter Summit, which exposed conflicts within the G.O.P.'s social conservative base.
snippet: Highlights from this weekend's Values Voter Summit, which exposed conflicts within the G.O.P.'s social conservative base.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)

lead_paragraph: Representative Ron Paul of Texas won the straw poll at the Values Voter Summit in Washington over the weekend, not much of a surprise given his campaign's propensity to truck in supporters. Mitt Romney didn't do so hot in the unscientific poll, but the more ominous sign for his appeal to religious conservatives came from a new flare-up in the debate over the nature of his faith.

headline.main: Looking Back at the Values Summit
